1. DNA is the genetic material found in the cells of living organisms, and it carries the genetic instructions for the development, functioning, growth, and reproduction of all known organisms.

The nuclear DNA contains the genetic instructions for the development and functioning of the organism, while mitochondrial DNA is involved in energy production and maternal inheritance. This distribution of DNA within different cellular compartments is crucial for understanding genetic traits, heredity, and the impact of DNA on various biological processes.
